repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - National Highway Asset
            Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the National Highway Asset
            Management Project for Argentina were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: factoring in project design the effects of
            an economic crisis. Need to recognize the complexity of
            certain participatory procedures involved in the
            implementation of any reform process aimed at transforming
            the modus operandi of a long established agency, and using
            adequate instruments to better accommodate the evolving
            institutional agenda. The need to ensure that preliminary
            designs for Rehabilitation and Maintenance Contract (CREMA)
            projects have balanced rehabilitation and maintenance
            standards commensurate to surface and traffic
            characteristics of the network, avoiding unnecessarily
            conservative solutions that could deviate from the optimum
            strategy and jeopardize the cost-efficiency of the system.
            Usefulness of independent technical audits as a valuable
            tool for the monitoring of contractors and supervision of
            performance during the execution of CREMA program.

5509136.majtheme: Public sector governance,Human development,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - National Highway Asset
            Management (APL) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The National Highway Asset Management
            Project for Argentina in support of the first phase of the
            National Highway Asset Management Program builds on the
            achievements of the ongoing National Highways Rehabilitation
            and Maintenance Project (rep. no. 17195) and has the
            following specific objectives: a) Preserve the condition of
            vital road assets. b) Strengthen road sector management
            through carrying out a renewal program of the National
            Highway Directorate (DNV) to revitalize its role. There are
            four project components. Component 1 expands the National
            Highways Directorate's CREMA Program, which supports
            rehabilitation and maintenance of nonconcessioned primary
            road network through performance based contracts. Component
            2 finances bridge restoration and construction management.
            Component 3 enhances road safety. Component 4 supports
            institutional Renewal of the DNV to consolidate its
            transformation into a results- oriented organization
            accountable for specific outputs.

docna.cdata!:
Argentina - National Highway Asset
            Management (APL) Project
